description: The International Jazz Collection (IJC) is the leading jazz archive in the Pacific Northwest. It features papers and photographs of the legendary Lionel Hampton and other important jazz figures, including Leonard Feather, Lee Morse, and Dizzy Gillespie.
Special Collections and Archives contains a vast amount of forestry related information.

The Day Mines collection is organized into seventy-three manuscript groups and includes the records of over eighty corporations or mining partnerships acquired by, merged with, or established by the family of Henry L. Day of Wallace, Idaho, or in which the Days at some time held a dominant interest.

University Archives document the broad history of the University of Idaho with administrative records, university programs and activities, departmental histories, faculty publications and papers, student activities, UI publications, photographs, and other records of University life.

Over 6,000 cubic feet of manuscripts include the personal papers of individuals and families; business records of lumber, railroad, mining, and other companies; papers of government officials, politicians, educators, authors, and business people; records of organizations such as religious, fraternal, and civic associations; and similar groups.

These collections consist of photographs in glass negative, negative, and print forms of life, people, and environments in Moscow and the University and surrounding areas. These images date from the mid-late 19th century to the 1970s and 1980s and record many events and places.

We have around 24,000 rare and unique books and university theses in our book collections. These include books written by specific authors, such as Ezra Pound, Sir Walter Scott, and Mark Twain, university theses and dissertations, and State of Idaho publications.
